intro: Piper hainana, commonly known as the Hainan pepper or Hainan long pepper, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Piperaceae family and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by elongated, cylindrical fruits that resemble peppercorns. Its fruit is often used in traditional medicine and as a spice, similar to black pepper. The botanical features of Piper hainana make it an important species in both horticulture and pharmacology.
